top_categories.workout_context: 160 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Pony Xpress Gravel 160's Colorado mountains, Ultra gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 160 miles.
At Pony Xpress Gravel 160, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
12,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
75ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 160 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Pony Xpress Gravel 160's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Pony Xpress Gravel 160. Train it until it feels boring.
160 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
12,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Low-cadence force work for 12,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Pony Xpress Gravel 160, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 160 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 160 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Pony Xpress Gravel 160. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Pony Xpress Gravel 160 demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride colorado mountains gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: colorado mountains, ultra gravel, high altitude. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 160 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 160 miles of colorado mountains gravel in Trinidad, CO.
